title-part.text: DRYING SOLID MATERIALS OR OBJECTS BY REMOVING LIQUID THEREFROM

reference.text: racks for drying fruit and vegetables A01F25/12 ; drying foodstuffs A23; drying hair A45D20/00 ; body-drying implements A47K10/00 ; drying household articles A47L,

CPC-specific-text.text: e.g. drying footwear A47L23/20 ;

reference.text: drying gases and vapours B01D; chemical and physical processes for dewatering or like separating liquids from solids B01D43/00 ; centrifugal apparatus B04; drying ceramics C04B33/30 ; drying yarns and fabrics in association with some other form of treatment D06C; drying frames for laundry without heating or positive air circulation, domestic and like spin-dryers, wringing and hot pressing laundry D06F; furnaces, kilns, ovens F27;

CPC-specific-text.text: treatment including a drying step of semiconductor substrates, e.g. wafers, H01L21/67028

note.note-paragraph:
The following IPC groups are not used in the CPC scheme. Subject matter covered by these groups is classified in the following CPC groups:
F26B11/06 covered by F26B11/0486
F26B13/02 covered by F26B13/10
F26B13/04 covered by F26B13/10
F26B13/20 covered by F26B13/104
F26B23/08 covered by F26B3/34 B, F26B3/347

title-part.text: Processes for drying
Preliminary treatment of solid materials or objects to facilitate drying,

CPC-specific-text.text: e.g. mixing or backmixing the materials to be dried with predominantly dry solids
by means of desintegrating, e.g. crushing, shredding, milling the materials to be dried

title-part.text: Drying solid materials or objects by processes involving the application of heat

reference.text: in specific machines or apparatus F26B9/00 to F26B19/00

CPC-specific-text.text: by applying a combustible liquid onto the materials, the liquid being burnt off subsequently

title-part.text: by convection, i.e. heat being conveyed from a heat source to the materials or objects to be dried by a gas or vapour, e.g. air
the gas or vapour circulating over or surrounding the materials or objects to be dried
the gas or vapour flowing through the materials or objects to be dried
so as to loosen them, e.g. to form a fluidised bed

reference.text: "fluidised-bed" technique in general B01J8/24 ; centrifugal fluidised beds F26B7/007

CPC-specific-text.text: arrangements of devices for distributing fluidising gas, e.g. grids, nozzles

reference.text: F26B3/0926 takes precedence; such devices per se B01J8/44

title-part.text: with heat exchange taking place in the fluidised bed,

CPC-specific-text.text: e.g. combined direct and indirect heat exchange

title-part.text: using inert thermally-stabilised particles
agitating the fluidised bed, e.g. by vibrating or pulsating

CPC-specific-text.text: by mechanical means, e.g. vibrated plate, stirrer
by pneumatic means, e.g. spouted beds

title-part.text: using a magnetic field to stabilise the fluidised bed
the gas or vapour carrying the materials or objects to be dried with it
in the form of a spray,

CPC-specific-text.text: i.e. sprayed or dispersed emulsions or suspensions

title-part.text: the materials or objects to be dried being moved by gravity
in a counter-flow of the gas or vapour
by conduction, i.e. the heat is conveyed from the heat source, e.g. gas flame, to the materials or objects to be dried by direct contact
the heat source being a heated surface

CPC-specific-text.text: ,e.g. a moving belt or conveyer
the materials to be dried covering or being mixed with heated inert particles which may be recycled

title-part.text: the heat source and the materials or objects to be dried being in relative motion, e.g. of vibration

CPC-specific-text.text: the materials or objects to be dried being immersed in a fluidised bed of heated particles

title-part.text: the movement being rotation
the movement being performed by gravity
by radiation, e.g. from the sun

CPC-specific-text.text: in combination with convection
by solar radiation

title-part.text: from infra-red-emitting elements

reference.text: by radiation emanating from passages containing heated fluids other than combustion gases F26B23/10

CPC-specific-text.text: the infra-red radiation being generated by combustion or combustion gases

title-part.text: by development of heat within the materials or objects to be dried,

CPC-specific-text.text: e.g. by fermentation or other microbiological action

title-part.text: by using electrical effects

CPC-specific-text.text: in combination with convection

title-part.text: Electromagnetic heating, e.g. induction heating or heating using microwave energy
Resistance heating,

CPC-specific-text.text: e.g. using the materials or objects to be dried as an electrical resistance

title-part.text: by using mechanical effects, e.g. by friction
Drying solid materials or objects by processes not involving the application of heat

reference.text: separating liquids from solids by straining B01D ; replacing liquids in wet solids by other liquids, e.g. water by spirit, B01D12/00 ; drying by electrophoresis B01J

CPC-specific-text.text: by dipping them into or mixing them with a chemical liquid, e.g. organic; chemical, e.g. organic, dewatering aids

reference.text: F26B3/005 takes precedence; using chemical vapours or gases F26B21/14

title-part.text: by using ultrasonic vibrations

reference.text: using sonic energy generated by pulse jet combustion F26B23/026

title-part.text: by evaporation or sublimation of moisture under reduced pressure, e.g. in a vacuum

note.note-paragraph: In subgroups F26B5/04 and F26B5/06 , the term "not including the application of heat" is disregarded for classification purposes. When drying with the use of vacuum, frequently heat is applied to compensate for the cooling effect or to promote sublimation from the frozen state

CPC-specific-text.text: for drying flowable materials, e.g. suspensions, bulk goods, in a continuous operation, e.g. with locks or other air tight arrangements for charging/discharging
for drying articles or discrete batches of material in a continuous or semi-continuous operation, e.g. with locks or other air tight arrangements for charging/discharging
for drying materials in a batch operation in an enclosure having a plurality of shelves which may be heated
for drying thin, flat articles in a batch operation, e.g. leather, rugs, gels
for continuous drying of material in long length, e.g. webs
in combination with heat developed by electro-magnetic means, e.g. microwave energy

title-part.text: the process involving freezing

CPC-specific-text.text: the product to be freeze-dried being sprayed, dispersed or pulverised

title-part.text: by centrifugal treatment
the process involving freezing
by suction
by applying pressure, e.g. wringing
by brushing
by wiping
by contact with sorbent bodies, e.g. absorbent mould
by admixture with sorbent materials
Drying solid materials or objects by processes using a combination of processes not covered by a single one of groups F26B3/00 and F26B5/00

CPC-specific-text.text: using an electric field and heat
using admixture with sorbent materials and heat, e.g. generated by the mixture
centrifugal fluidised beds

Removable covering devices, e.g. pliable or flexible

in presses or clamping devices
in stationary drums or chambers

CPC-specific-text.text: e.g. pneumatic recirculation arrangements

moving the material in a substantially vertical sense using conveyers or agitators, e.g. screws or augers with vertical axis, which are positioned inside the drying enclosure

in pans or tables in rooms

the channels to be inserted into the stack, e.g. after its formation

in moving drums or other mainly-closed receptacles

CPC-specific-text.text: Arrangements of drives, bearings, supports
Arrangements for gas-sealing the drum
Arrangements for charging or discharging the materials to be dried, e.g. discharging by reversing drum rotation, using spiral-type inserts

Arrangements for the supply or exhaust of gaseous drying medium for direct heat transfer, e.g. perforated tubes, annular passages, burner arrangements, dust separation, combined direct and indirect heating

CPC-specific-text.text: with internal subdivision of the drum, e.g. for subdividing or recycling the material to be dried

CPC-specific-text.text: the subdivision consisting of a plurality of substantially radially oriented internal walls, e.g. forming multiple sector-shaped chambers
the subdivision consisting of concentric walls, e.g. multi-pass or recirculation systems; the subdivision consisting of spiral-shaped walls

reference.text: tubular or annular passages for supply or exhaust of drying gas F26B11/028

the tubes having internal members
Constructional details, e.g. arrangements of drives, supports, bearings, gas-sealing, heating medium supply or exhaust
Arrangements for feeding or discharging materials to be dried
comprising multiple stages, e.g. multiple rotating drums subsequently receiving the material to be dried; Provisions for heat recuperation
the drum or receptacle having a variable outer or inner diameter in axial direction, e.g. trunconical; the drum or receptacle having a polygonal or non-cylindrical shape
having conductive heating arrangements, e.g. heated drum wall
using heated internal elements, e.g. which move through or convey the materials to be dried
the elements being discs
the elements being chains
having internal elements, e.g. which are being moved or rotated by means other than the rotating drum wall
for disintegrating, crushing, or for being mixed with the materials to be dried
the elements being loose bodies or materials, e.g. balls, which may have a sorbent effect

the elements having a screw- or auger-like shape, or form screw- or auger-like channels
the elements being held stationary, e.g. internal scraper blades
with provisions for working under increased or reduced pressure, with or without heating
with provisions for drying by electro-magnetic means, e.g. radiation, microwaves
